reviews.review_text: My friends and I had such a great time at Calabash! The food was delicious - we shared the veggie curry (which comes with fragrant rice, a beautiful salad and plantains), a side of roti and the coconut dumplings with mango butter (to die for!). The spicy plantain margaritas were amazing - our server added a special touch for us, so that made us feel pretty special. The staff were all so kind. After we left, we went back for dancing later. They played great music and it was a wholesome, fun vibe. The place is highly secure. We felt very safe inside despite it being in the DTES area.
Food is so well flavoured, wholesome and satisfying. Roti is perfect chewiness. Those coconut dumpling with guava butter are too good! Cocktails are also absolutely delicious

Hands down the best Caribbean food in Metro Vancouver. Its hard to recommend just one item on the menu because everything is so good. The service is great and the atmosphere is lively. Its a vibe    If Youre visit Vancouver, definitely hit up Calabash one night for dinner. You wont be disappointed!

The food is great, Caribbean food mixed with a slight bit of Canadian. Definitely a different vibe! The location isn t the best but if you re looking for Caribbean food, this is the place to go! The old school reggae music playing in the background adds to the vibe. The employees don t seem to be Caribbean people but they have a good knowledge of what s going on and what they re serving. I would 10/10 recommend.

Excellent Caribbean food from a social enterprise that is sure to impress all! Love to come here and plan trips to Vannjust to do so. They make there own ginger beer.... try a Dsrk n Stormy (shopping good)

I didn t get to try the food, other than some bread my friend had. I wish I did because it had this sauce that was so flavorful. I m sure everything else is seasoned well and full of flavor. I did get drinks, rum punch, and it was delicious. I would love to come back and try more food!
One of the best Caribbean restaurants in the city. We had the Pork belly appy, oxtail main & their signature Dark & Stormy s of course. We love Calabash.

A really nice night at Calabash. Pork belly  appie so delicious. Fun, funky place. We dined but there is also live entertainment at this venue down stairs. Im giving it a five star however it bordered on a 4.5 as service wasnt bad but pretty slow. Possibly a result of pandemic and staff shortages and frankly if youre not in any hurry the service will be quite fine but has a little room for improvement. Bevies were outstanding and food flavours were fantastic.  Perhaps a few more items could be added to the menu. A great salad was enjoyed there.

Delicious Caribbean food in a lively atmosphere. We were seating downstairs for the first time back to dine in since restrictions were lifted. We ordered the jerk chicken and oxtail. Both dishes were very tasty and perfectly spiced. The plaintains and coconut dumplings were also great sides that came with the oxtail. Will definitely return to explore more of the menu.

I have a vegan soup and oxtail tonights its cooked right on spot really opens up my stomach for oxtail.  The portion is huge and looking really nice.  My partner orders that poutine and something else. The servers are awesome.  The clear communication for allergies and alternative when one option dont work through.  I highly appreciated that. The music is just good to hear and not loud enough to annoying.  its pineapple everywhere so check out this tropical place in the Raincouver. The restaurant has a red wall with a huge art work which opens up imagination while waiting for food.

Food is fantastic, the oxtail was cooked to perfection, popcorn lobster was brilliant, the hot sauce is absolutely addictive. Chef Kevin brings excellent specials that compliment the menu. The rum punch is likely the best you can find anywhere in Vancouver. Great service as well!

For the price point, I feel like you really do get what you pay for. The portion sizes are large and filling and the food is quite involved and has a lot of different components. Everything tastes fresh and delicious. I had the oxtail which was braised until tender and gelatinous in some parts--exactly how it should be. My partner had the fried cod that was fried in a house-made flour mix and it was wonderful. Service was fast and friendly. I want to come back time and time again.

Wow what an experience. The food, the environment, the people it was all worth it. This place is definitely a hidden gem. We went for dinner it was a very Lively crowd for sure and we ended up staying for a little bit of dancing afterwards. The staff are super helpful and so nice. I definitely will be coming back here.

Where do I start?  I had brunch there and it was delicious.  I had to ackee and saltfish with dumplings.  My favorite was the dumplings.  My partner and I had some leftovers and fought over them when we got home!  The rice and peas are different from how my friend makes them, but I still enjoyed them.  I would love to go again and try something different this time!  I loved the spice, it was just the right amount!

The food, the ambience, the music, all WOW!! The first taste of the food took me to heaven! They were so scrumptious that we barely had a conversation at the table! The waiters were attentive and professional as well. Hats off to Calabash

Excellent and Authentic Mexican street tacos! Very tasty. Very friendly. Ask them to make a little more spicy and it s perfect!       Also, very clean for the area it s in. Their food feels good in my stomach.

My husband and I went here on Mexican day. I ordered fondito and quessadilla with beef, if you like cheese, these are your go to. My husband ordered some tacos. The food was Delicious!!! I ate quessadilla with pickled cucumbers and hot sauce. It was so tasty!! Well def come back again.

The food was absolutely delicious. We were a group of seven and there was not a single complaint. The oxtail was perfect, the mango and goat cheese salad is a MUST. Portions are very generous. Drinks were great too. The only negative was really the experience downstairs. They have a bar/lounge with a DJ where we went after our meal. I dont know if it was the DJ or if one of the speakers was glitching, but it was really really bad. The volume would go to extreme loudness then back to low, then back to extremely loud and back to low. It did that for a solid 45 minutes. At some point it was loud to the point of it hurting our ear drums.  We left for that reason, it was genuinely painful. We ended the night at another bar. We were pretty disappointed ! Would ve loved to stay longer.
This is hands down one of the best restaurants I have ever been to! I got the Raggae on Broadway for a cocktail. Im still dreaming about the cocktail and food I had - it was delicious!

Happened to pop in here for a drink and some food. Sat at the bar and decided to only go with what the wonderful bartender recommended. The food? WOW! Amazing and the portions are generous as well. The drinks? Handmade and so delicious. We will be making this a regular hang out for sure because the service? Just as damn great as the food and drinks! Shes amazing Vegetarian options: Goat cheese roti
The culinary highlight to our trip to Vancouver. The vibe, food, music, drinks, and staff were top notch. Gonna dream about that jerk mussels for years to come!
Food was delicious and service was great. I ordered the jerk poutine and my partner had the roti and really enjoyed his meal.

I ve always had a wonderful and warm experience at Calabash! The food is flavourful and exciting. I often get the vegetarian recipes and this time the stuffed plantain did not disappoint! I think it should be added as a regular. I was there on a special Valentine s Day set course menu. The staff are amazing. The Chef is incredibly humble and warm. There is no risk to your safety. If you re driving, park at Tinseltown and walk over. You may encounter some visually distressing human suffering. The food, atmosphere and music is always worth it, in my opinion. Thank you Chef!
The food was sensational, staff were professionally friendly, and the music was cheerful. Perfect combination!
Review | Casual Dining (1~5) #Atmosphere: Server Professionalism 5 | Interior Design 5 | Menu Design 4 | Hygiene 3 #Food: Serve Speed 4 | Food Quality 4 | Taste 5 #Price Overall: $$$

Excellent food and drink options, and a cozy atmosphere. Easy to get to from the Stadium sky train station and close to other Gastown attractions. I was very impressed with their Indian style of serving the fresh seafood curry I ordered!
Really great tasting food but pricey. I highly recommend the prawns + papaya salad. The Dark and Stormy is incredible!
Really good food, I highly recommend trying this place. There were three tacos, one was eaten before I could get a photo.
AMAZING!!!!!!!!! YOU HAVE TO GO HERE!!!!!! We absolutely love this place. They have the most amazing food and drinks. The dark and stormy is unreal.

This place was great. I went for the first time last night, the food was excellent and the servers were very good at their jobs. Super friendly and efficient. There was also the added bonus dancing in the basement which was a lot of fun and such a nice change to hear good music! Will definitely be back. Definitely get a reservation thought because it was very busy. Vegetarian options: Multiple options
Flavors are amazing - doubles n jerk ckn tacos OMG   Rum punch is perfect. Very nice ambience

Was visiting from Toronto to attend the All Vinyl party. It was such a chill vibe. Everyone was on the dance floor  having such a great time, which I love to see. The DJs played all of my favourite old school tunes. Was feeling nostalgic! The bistro has such a uniqueness, it was decorated with vibrant artwork by local artists. They usually have various events that take place throughout the week and weekends.  There is something for everyone. The next time I make another visit to Van City, I will be sure to check out the restaurant next.

Thirsty Thursday s are a riot! Live music and discounted Dark and Stormies! 100% Do recommend! And when you do, get more than 1 order of the dumplings cuz they are deadly!!!! Wash that delicious dumpling down with their Dark and Stormy made with their very own in-house ginger beer brew that is unlike any other in Vancouver that I have come across. 10 And don t forget to check out the art display downstairs to add local artists to your personal collection!!

I ve been to Calabash Bistro several times and each experience was flavourful from the appetizers, main courses to rum punches. This time I attended Calabash 8th Birthday Bash with an IT consultant friend. We enjoyed not only the food, especially the tiger prawns marinated in spicy sauce on skewers with the rum punches, Jamaican beers, we had very courteous service upstairs and live entertainment downstairs. It was a fun night; just exit towards Pender Street rather than Hastings Street, you won t be disappointed! We met one of the partners, Ron Collins on the way out and we told him we really enjoyed a night of Caribbean / Jamaican food and culture!

Been here a couple times and always super great vibes and the food and the staff are both awesome! Our server Colleen was so friendly and knowledgeable and her and the bar team down stairs gave us quality service! Definitely will be back
Amazing food and drinks. The dark and stormy is topped with coconut shavings and cinnamon.
food is great! but hey... the vibes, beats and drinks are amazing! great place to get together with friends!
Best Caribbean food in Vancouver. Fantastic food, Great rums, and Friendly staff.

Man let me tell you. Friends of ours booked a birthday celebration here that included dinner that came out in 3 parts. When you first look up the location of this spot you quickly realize its right next to East Hastings, okay no problem, and once you get close to the restaurant you realize its REALLY right next to East Hastings, but im here to tell you, do NOT let that throw you off from going here. The service from literally EVERYONE was fantastic, our waitress was so happy to serve and make a great experience for all of us. I was nervous about the food that was going to be served because im a fussy eater but good god the food was awesome. The atmosphere, staff, food and even the room temperature (considering it was downstairs and quite packed) was all perfect. Kudos to all the staff for making such a memorable experience for me!

Absolutely incredible food, cocktails and service!  I went for the amazing rum selection and flights which did not disappoint and my friends and I were truly impressed with the entire experience.  Our waiter was charming and took excellent care of us and the house aged cocktails make the place a true standout.  We will definitely be visiting again soon!

It s incredibly hard to find a place that does oxtail well, especially in a city with so few Caribbean restaurants, but Calabash excels in every way possible. The menu is short and sweet but offers various items without too much repetition. The items, pairings, and flavours are all traditional while still adding a contemporary touch that brings out the flavours rather than drowning them out.  The food was perfectly cooked, and perfectly paired. I ve never been happier with a dish in my life. The manager/server Jan was the perfect touch to an outgoing atmosphere. His comprehensive menu knowledge, recommendations and quick service was exceptional. The cocktails were perfectly balanced and made me realize that I had never had a proper Dark and Stormy in my life. Rum list was extensive, and the rum flights are a nice touch. The atmosphere is fantastic. The art, music, and venue downstairs is gorgeous and the service is incredible. All in all, amazing. We had the plantain with goat cheese as an appetizer, and the large plate oxtail. Drinks were two Dark and Stormy, Calabash Punch and the Mai Tai.

I had so much fun there. I wasn t expecting anything because my friends brought me there. Seriously when they put the music people started dancing and enjoying themselves. I am not sure if it was the place or the people entirely who created that atmosphere. It was my only night in Vancouver but a very memorable one in this bar.

The staff is just awesome,  really nice people, The place itself, is just great, a nice Vibe, if you are out on a date, or with your friends,  its  comfortable. Great music downstairs,  live DJ really lights it up. The food, well I just keep going back, its really good,  and fresh.Hats off to the chefs, these guys are special. Bartenders know how to spin a drink too, nice beverage menu. Check it out , it will be one of your favorites too.

This place is such a gem. The service is super friendly, the ambiance is a kind of mashup between hip/romantic/welcoming, and theres just a vibe you dont get in other Vancouver restaurants. The cuisine is unique and rewards ordering outside your comfort zone, no matter what, you have to get the jerk wings; in a world full of overpriced wings, these are worth every penny and more. Also, my girlfriends keys fell out of her pocket while we were there, and the servers chased us down to return them after we left. Just above and beyond. Love this place.
Enjoyed a lot, tried the guac, pork belly, chicken curry, and oxtail. All great.

People might write off this location considering its proximity to the corner of East Hastings and Main, but thats just silly! The place inside is so warm and friendly, and their bar downstairs is awesome. Their jerk chicken is by far THE BEST Ive had in Vancouver yet! SO good!!! Love this place!
Amazing food, the mango salsa, WOW! incredible drinks, fabulous atmosphere and TOP service. Highly recommend.

Calabash is my straight up feel-good like I m home type of restaurant. Great food and even better vibes. If u want Caribbean, the food is great but doesn t even compare to the hospitality they represent. 11 out of 10 always, hands down!

This place is phenomenal in not only service, but atmosphere and comfort. The service when I went was excellent, and they easily made exceptions to their food for me because of my allergies (I had the jerk chicken with the Thai coconut sauce instead of the regular sauce). Bartenders were great at their jobs and always happy to serve our party, the good was spectacular, and the live music hit all the right notes to end the party off with a bang. Definitely a place I will be going to again!

I did not really expect much in spite of reading all the good reviews because this was my first time having Caribbean food. My friend and I ordered jerk pork belly and oxtail stew to share and they were amazing. Coconut dumplings in each dish were also remarkable. And finally, the signature rum drink was a perfect cocktail.

Long overdue but here it is! One of the best place to have your birthdays at! My boyfriend surprise me with this place and it was amazing! They have the most delicious Jamaican foods After 10PM, they turn the downstairs into a dance floor! The DJ is super friendly and does an excellent job at keeping the beats going! I been recommending this place to everyone because the customer service went beyond expectations

Calabash is a fantastic restaurant. The jerk chicken and the coconut dumplings especially are to die for! Their new family style delivered meals are incredible and theyve always been very cautious with allergies.  Good food, good people, cant recommend this restaurant enough!!

Visited Vancouver and this was the last thing I thought I would find. I LOVED this place. Loved the staff. The drinks had very precise and thoughtful recipes. They were delicious. So good, we came back for dinner that night. I had the oxtail and my boyfriend had the Jerk Chicken. My favorite part of my dish was the coconut dumpling. Oh My God. So delicious. You must go. The atmosphere was enjoyable. At night they have a lounge downstairs as well. Perfect place for those who love West Indian food.

Phenomenal Caribbean food at a great price. Their menu is not massive but it also helps with selecting something quickly or sharing a few plates amongst your group. Highly recommend the Roti Stack - full of flavour, plenty of cheese and a great spicy kick. Also try out one of the rum flights - excellent selections available!

Very friendly staff and great tasting food. I was not sure what to pick from the menu and the waitress helped me pick a great dish. The decor is traditional but can use some modern touch to attract more younger people. Great experience. Will definitely go again.

This is my very first time in Vancouver and a friend of mind recommended this place to me. I havent try the food as yet but I went to reggae night on Saturday and I had the best time of my life. The music was awesome, and the staff was just as awesome as the atmosphere. Every one just had a great time. I am most definitely going back there.

I loved the place. Yeah the portions aren t that big but what are you expecting? The prices are reasonable for what you are getting and where you are getting it from. The food quality and taste was fantastic.  Definitely will be back again. Recommendation: seafood curry and the ginger beer( made in house!!)

Only had drinks at this but they were very good. They make alot of artisan cocktails with homemade ingredients. The night we went they had live music which was really fun! Want to go back and dine there as the food looked delicious!

Absolutely delicious food, laidback atmosphere We visited here as I really wanted some jerk chicken on our trip to Vancouver. The jerk chicken was pretty good but the reason I want to highlight this restaurant is the pork belly starter, one of the tastiest dishes I have had in months. If I was you, I would go just for this starter - it is a combination of texture, flavour and beautifully tender pork that you will not forget. This place also some jazz nights in their lounge downstairs. The ambiance and service was top drawer.
Good food, good service and good music. Server was attentive, food was so delicious. We ended up staying for old school hip hop on a Friday night.

I m a new Vancouverite and I have to admit this place isn t located in the friendliest neighbourhood BUT the food and service is fantastic! Don t worry about the location, once you are inside everything changes. We made reservations ahead and as we were eating we noticed the lines were never ending which also included delivery/pickup orders. That really says something about their food and service. They have a great cocktail menu. I ordered the coconut jumby and my husband ordered the dark and stormy. For food, we ordered the jerk chicken and chicken curry wrapped in roti. We would recommend both dishes. We had great service, the staff was very friendly and checked in on us. I didn t have room for dessert this time. I will definitely be back!

My daughter and I were here for vacation. We were told about this restaurant so we stopped in. There was a calm and relaxed atmosphere along with the Jamaican music.  The hostess was pleasant and attentive. The food was delicious. I had the oxtails with rice, peas, and asparagus. There was also  plantains and coconut dumplings. My daughter had the Jerk chicken with rice,  asparagus, plantains and coconut dumplings. When you are in town , please make Calabash one of your stops.

staff is lovely and so attentive here - ive been back 2x in a week!  one went into the history of the jerk spices we were enjoying and was super passionate about it. The jerk poutine is addicting and the dark and stormies are so flavourful!  amazing music, vibes and art. come check this place out! lots of families around dinnertime too which was nice!

Fun place and good music. I havent tried the restaurant but there is a dance-floor and DJ downstairs. The music is a mix of dancehall, hip hop and Afro beats. Its very well ventilated so perfect place in the summer time. The only con, drinks are very expensive $13-15.

Wow I have to say this place is amazing   , cute inside great service and music! We had a great time after this pandemic was a nice change of pace. Was spicy but not too much and they had great cocktails too! Thank you for a wonderful evening.

loved it. amazing food. only downside was that they sat us at the bar to wait for a table (you get a waft of the pee smell from the street when the door opens) and the bartender took our order while we were there.  we didnt want to eat at the bar but they made a big deal of us moving to a proper table.  theres just no need for that. handle your division of tips on your own time and leave the customer out of it!

Absolutely one of the best spots to eat in Vancouver. Amazing Atmosphere and delicious food. The portions arent enormous but taste every bit the dollar you pay for them. Great staff and drink selection as well. Was my first time here. Ill be making this a regular spot before Rickshaw concerts from now on.

I had a great chicken curry and the rum cocktails are fantastic.  The service was extremely friendly and well definitely be going back. If I had one criticism it was that things took a long time, but they were busy and we were there with friends so didnt mind too much.

We had gone for a walk looking for sushi and ended up in this incredible place. The staff are amazing, friendly and personable. The food was delicious and well presented and their Dark and Stormys have a well-earned reputation as one of the best in the world. We will be back for sure!

My favourite restaurant! This gem is everything Vancouver needs! The environment, art and music and staff are amazing! The food oh my the food! Your taste buds will never forget the flavours these dishes produce. My mouth is watering as I write this! You wont regret or forget going to Calabash Bistro!

Wow! Spectacular, start to finish.  From the front of the house to the kitchens, there is real talent throughout. The Dark and Stormy cocktail was worth every sip. Then, we enjoyed a perfectly spiced appetizer called Doubles, flavorful discs of bread topped with chickpeas that worked so well with accompanying pepper sauce. Next, perfectly tender chicken curry served in a charming picnic-style stack of containers, a side of crispy fries and chicken skewers that melted in the mouth. Portions were sized well, so we were satisfied as it was with a little leftover for taking home, but how could we not at least see what they could do with dessert? We decided on the bread pudding, and didnt leave any behind. Warm, with the perfect amount of sweetness and a small touch of something that we thought was maybe anise? I dont know, but 10 out of 10, would eat again. This is only our first night in Vancouver, but itll be tough to top this meal.

This place was simple and amazing! the venue is cozy, the music was chill, cocktails on point, service was awesome, portions were generous and delicious. it is a little on the pricey side but our experience last night was worth every penny. thank you calabash for the good vibes and incredible food.

I went to this restaurant last night for my birthday dinner and was totally wowed by how amazing everything was, the food was incredible so delicious! The service was also amazing. You could tell how passionate the staff were about the food which I just love! I would go back in a heart beat! Love love love this place!

Really good. I enjoyed the food, atmosphere, and service. I like a lot of flavor so I ordered the oxtail. my wife ordered  the chicken curry it was very mild but thats how she likes it we also git the curry fried chicken, delicious.
The waiter who helped us was super friendly and gave us great food and drink recommendations

Food is insanely good. Even though it has an modern, eclectic take on Jamaican cuisine it is 100% the real deal. The coconut dumplings were a hit! So good. Next time Im back in Vancouver this will be a definite stop.

Amazing Jamaican food! I make a trips across the border just for the oxtail, it s that good! Most of the food here is gluten free, but stay away from anything fried and dumplings. As always, let your server know about any allergies, they are all knowledgeable about celiac disease. Don t forget to make a reservation, the place fills up fast.

I love this place!  And have recommended it to many people. Amazing food and ambience upstairs and beautiful music to dance to downstairs.  It can get hot downstairs with all the dancing and people. Great drinks.  Careful going up and down those stairs!

Great for big casual parties. You can rent out the downstairs area for corporate events or team building exercises. Its super casual, the food is good, staff is friendly. We had a really good time and they were very flexible setting up our options and letting us plan our team activity prior to everyones arrival time.

From Toronto where we have many Caribbean restaurants from sitting in to take out, but the fusion of authentic Caribbean food, culture, art, music is one of a kind. Combine this with friendly faces and pampering service makes me jealous that this restaurant isnt in Toronto yet. Visited here over half dozen times when in town for work and theyve yet to disappoint. I often read the low rated reviews before going out to eat and found the ones here funny. From the clubbing scene is average to scared to walk from my car to the restaurant to getting pepper sprayed, people have rated low not because of the food or service but because of incidents beyond control. I agree with 95% of the reviews of 4 or 5 stars and applaud Calabash Bistro for staying true to Caribbean roots 10 years and counting.

Dinner and dance party for a wonderful friend on a Friday night.  DJ was incredible and got the whole 30 people Singing and moving instead of eating.  Food was great but the vibe was a vacation. Rum punch, Carib beer, Berry shooters and a dance floor full of great people. Auto gratuity on the large party, maybe on the drinks as well, keep that in mind as the drinks were more money than what Im used to paying.

Went in for Valentines Day, the server was great! Friendly, prompt, attentive. Food is always amazing, happy about the veggie and vegan options as well! Would totally recommend this! Bonus is the music downstairs!

Delicious Caribbean food restaurant with a cool vibe. Weve only experienced brunch so far, and it is awesome.  Great drinks like the Dark and Stormy add to the experience.  Dont miss out on the coconut hollandaise.

Food was fantastic. We would go back again simply based on that. But add to that the most personable efficient service, and you have the perfect dining storm. I want nothing more than to transport this restaurant and its staff to the island. Thank you for a terrific evening!

Had a great brunch here. The basket of baked goods with mango butter was out of this world. Our 2 brunches were also delicious and good portion sizes. Lots of vegetarian options as well. Friendly service in a relaxed atmosphere.

Wonderful! Great atmosphere fab service tasty authentic food so yummy..must make reservations.They fill up fast. Definitely worth it..extensive drink selection even rum flights! Entertainment downstairs..a real gem! Must go..

I loved the live music in the basement. Very artistic decor. I didnt try any food but I definitely will go back..... OK Im back to edit my review.. I tried the vegetarian curry the Lamb curry the plantain chips and the chicken kebab... And.. everything was delicious! Very flavorful and mildly spicy.

Excellent food. Great atmosphere. Cocktails were a bit pricey but very nicely done. We were there for Reggae night and there was a bit of a wait to get a table but it was well worth it. I ate the vegetarian curry roti, and it was extremely tasty. Fresh ingredients like lime zest, mint and lemongrass, and coconut slivers in the drinks. Bordertown Sizzle with tamarind syrup was excellent. I didnt try any rums neat but there definately was a vast selection. Servers were very friendly. Nice touch that after eating a meal there was no cover to the downstairs bar and music. Definitely will go back.

This one took Me by surprise. I have a high bar when it comes on to the Caribbean food. Especially if you want to name your restaurant after Caribbean dishes. But this restaurant gets a five star rating from me the Jamaican chef. Bunch of Canadians cooking in the kitchen their food was amazing. They could learn a thing or two from me but I would eat there again. Lotta different twist to the Caribbean dishes but I will definitely recommend this restaurant to my friends. The servers were off the chain. Remembering our names from the minute we told her. Well done guys. See you soon

Placed my first order for delivery. This is the first Caribbean restuarant Ive tried since moving from the UK. The jerk chicken was excellent, good amount of hotness to still enjoy the food. The plantain , delightful as expected. I greedily wish there was more jerk sauce. Also ordered patties which were nice. Next order, roti!. Thanks for being my new fav spot.
Always good food always good vibes. Jerk chicken and oxtail are amazing, the chicken patties and those little coconut dumpling things are the BEST. The cocktails are also a win.

Amazing place! Incredible food, cocktails and live music! DJs are awesome and service is wonderful. I highly recommend Calabash for a night of taste bud rocking, body and soul moving and cocktail sipping! Kudos Calabash crew!

Every single time I come here I am impressed with the service. Honestly, the staff are some of the friendliest, happiest and attentive staff in Vancouver! It doesnt matter if its buying clothing or having dinner, I have a super high standard coming from the customer industry myself and you guys FAR outweigh my expectations every time. Much love!!! ps.. the food is amazing too! :)

Delicious Caribbean food, perfect if you like sweet and spicy. Come hungry cuz the dishes are very filling. But if you stay late theres great music to dance to! And then theres the rum... a massive selection that just warms the heart.

This place never ceases to amaze me with their lovely beautiful staff, amazingly tasty wonderful food and great drinks. I love sitting at the bar or the table it doesnt matter its always the best experience. Go downstairs for dancing I dont do it enough but it is the best thing too. I really cant say enough great things about Calabash

Great Jamaican place, the workers are friendly, comforting and open, good vibe here, I look forward coming back. Try the dumplings with the mango guava butter, patties and the goat curry(only thing I eat here when I go) but Friday Saturdays, they have a club downstairs, good people.

Bar service was speedy and friendly. Drinks were delicious. Food was stellar. Had three apps and split them. All were delicious and plenty of food for three. The spices were authentic and the ingredients very fresh.
They make amazing cocktails

So Im West Indian and was visiting Vancouver and my cousin brought me here and I couldnt have been more SATISFIED. A restaurant that serves food upstair and like a club downstairs? Only thing is...we had a group of like 8,9 and it took over an hourrrrr to get a table, maybe even longer than that. WE killed time by going downstairs and having a few drinks. I got the vegetarian roti which was teuly a blessing. Definitely one of the best rotis Ive had! I was soooooo happy. Afterwards, we went downstairss to party. What more could I ask for. Shots were a reasonable price, I dont remember how much-but if they were unreasonable WOULDNT HAVE BOUGHT EM! lol. I had a great experience here. I was starving and didnt want to leave, but that wait did really kill me. But the food made me happy. There was also a rally friendly host that night who kept giving us updates, she plays a strong role in why we stayed. I dont remember her name but I was here the night of March 16th into the morning of the 17th, so please thank her. I want to come back here next time Im in Vancouver and hopefully the wait is significantly less because next time I JUST CANT (but I still probably will)! thanks so much =) Music was solid, enough to vibe to and it was an overall great time. They need to play soca though...

We had our Treetop Christmas party at Calabash last night and it was outstanding.  The food was fantastic and the service friendly and efficient.  On a side note the 3 partners are big soccer fans but only Sam is enlightened enough to support Liverpool!
